answers.answer: http://www.americanpregnancy.org/pregnancyhealth/eatingfortwo.htmlWhere does all the extra weight go?Here is an approximate breakdown of your weight gain:Baby: 7-8 poundsPlacenta: 1-2 poundsAmniotic fluid: 2 poundsUterus: 2 poundsMaternal breast tissue: 2 poundsMaternal blood : 4 poundsFluids in maternal tissue: 4 poundsMaternal fat and nutrient stores: 7 poundsHow much total weight should I gain?The amount of weight you should gain depends on your weight before pregnancy. You should gain:25-37 pounds if you were a healthy weight before pregnancy.28-40 pounds if you were underweight before pregnancy.15-25 pounds if you were overweight before pregnancy.At what rate should I gain weight during my pregnancy?How much you should gain depends on your weight before you were pregnant and how far along you are in your pregnancy.Healthy weight before pregnancy:3-5 pounds during the first trimesterApproximately 1-2 pounds per week in the second trimesterApproximately 1-2 pounds per week in the third trimesterUnderweight before pregnancy:5-6 pounds or more in your first trimester; this also can depend on how underweight you were before pregnancy & your health care provider's recommendations1-2 pounds per week in the second and third trimestersOverweight before pregnancy:Approximately 1-2 pounds in the first trimesterApproximately 1 pound per week during the last six months
I am 29 weeks pregnant and I have gained 28 pounds total, but I was thin before I go pregnant, so now every time I ask my OB if it is normal she says that it is great.

Thanks for the info. I have only gained 14 lbs so far and I was a little on the chunky side despite my avid runners schedule. Doc hasn't said anything to me though. Just said to keep doing what I've been doing.

Haha,Yeah Preggy Woman vs. Doctor's Scale.  Mine (Obe and Endo) also hit the roof at my last visit when I'd gained 10lbs in a month by my OBE's scale and 12 lbs by my Endo's Scale.  They were both shaking their heads and both asked for urine tests (Either they're worried about risk of preeclampsia - or else just convinced I'm a pig and glutton).....Seriously though, I can gain 6 lbs overnight and then it will disappear in the next 3 days (leaving maybe 1/2 lb)... so it depends when they weigh... and full bladder, bowel, clothes and breakfast do add up to the lbs...Anyways am well on the way to another 10lbs for this month.... :(  ..... dreading my next scheduled appointments....  Total gain now about 12 lbs since prepreg - but 20 lbs since lowest weight at end of 3rd trimester... which is where it appears they're counting from...Guess we're all normal!
My Dr. is known to NEVER say a word. He has never been concerned w/ weight gain in pregnant women.. I like that about my Dr.!

question: Ok, since I have been pg, I have been tracking my weight gain weekly at home.  I started out overweight, so I wanted to make sure I kept within the recommended guidelines for my pre-pregancy weight group.  As of this week, I have gained a total of 14 pounds and Im approx. 26 weeks.  Now, that's right in line with where I should/can be.After my visit to the OB last night at 7:15pm for my routine checkup, their scale said I had gained 10pds in the last month!  I was upset and basically freaking out.  The midwife explained to me how to cut back on calories that were empty, you know, the whole talk about watching weight gain.  I listened carefully and fully understood that I would have to watch.  I was still a little taken back since my scale at home showed 4 pounds gained this past month.  In fact, I had lost 2pds when I had my kidney infection, so I had been happy when I gained those 2 pounds back and then another 2.After I got home and talked to DH, he suggested that I get on our scale to see if it matched the office's scale. Sure enough, it did.  My scale was working just fine. Well, then I took off my two sweaters and cords and low and beyond, I was 3 pounds less.  (I had on a thin sweater with a heavy sweater over it b/c I was cold and Im not quite ready to wear my winter coat.)  I always take off my shoes to be weighed at the OB since my shoes are a tad heavy - they are Dansko clogs.  Btw, these are the most comfortable shoes ever..atleast for me!Anyway, went I got up this am, before eating breakfast, I weighed myself like I do every week and voila...I was back to the weight I thougth I was.  What a relief!I think it was a combo of my heavier winter clothes and that I had just eaten whole can of tomato soup for dinner before heading over to the office.  I plan on discussing this with my OB at my next appointment.Just wanted to put this out there in case anyone else has run into this problem. The only thing now is that my chart is flagged for weight gain.  Oh well....can't win them all.
title: Weight gain me vs. the OB
